intro: Phyllanthus asperulatus, commonly known as the rough phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
